reviews: This hotel has excellent service and is in a fine location. I found the bed very comfortable and the room peaceful and safe. The food in the restaurants is okay but not great. It is very expensive in my opinion, but for the convenience of location and comfort I have stayed her twice.

The staff, room and accommodations were excellent! Definitely enjoyed my stay. The room was more than adequate and clean. The staff kept the room clean while I was away for meetings, and they kept the in-room refrigerator stocked with snacks and drinks which was very nice to enjoy in the evenings when I returned to the room.

My wife and I stayed at this hotel for a long weekend.  We found the staff to be friendly staff.  We enjoyed wonderful views of the park from an upper floor room.  We really enjoyed the great location, convenient to parks, museums, restaurants, and the very pleasant Polanco neighborhood.

We were working in Mexico City and as always stayed at the Hyatt Regency.  The staff is very supportive no matter what silly thing we need.  This time it was shredding extra paperwork - note there is a shredder in the business center.    The food in the main restaurant is tasty.  I particularly liked the short rib tacos, but be warned, they are juicy so be prepared to make a mess.    The rooms are large, the closets ample, the how water in the shower is relaxing.    Overall a great property.

Everything was above expectations. Hotel was in great condition.  Staff was so very helpful and so caring.  The food at the two restaurants we ate in was delicious and the presentation was superb.  The location of this hotel is the best.

My preferred hotel when in business trips due its location, attentive service and staff and comfortable and functional room. I feel at home in Hyatt. Love the Japanese restaurants, AMADO pastelería y Rulfo.

Wonderful hotel! Very clean, great rooms, good service, and good sleep quality. The place is very clean and upscale. The upstairs lounge was awesome, good food and drinks! The pool is wonderful. The breakfast is the best part! Fresh food and fruit, huge selection!

My family and I really enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt Regency Mexico City this past weekend!  The hotel is in excellent condition and I was treated really well as a Globalist.  The staff is excellent and very friendly.  Along w/enjoying the hotel itself, we also loved the neighborhood as there was plenty to walk to nearby and we felt safe the entire time.  I'll definitely look to stay here again on my next trip to Mexico City.

Enrique, Carlos, and Guadalupe in the Rulfo restaurants were amazing/Arturo in the lobby is too perfect to accurately describe; 6 star customer service and we loved them extremely! Also, and forgive me as we can't remember her name, there was a kind and caring cleaner that was working the restrooms on the 2nd floor that was beyond wonderful. The only critique we have was a major one; the room heater would not stay on to match the temperature and would turn off after a few minutes - my wife and I both got sick because of it. In the restrooms there are automatic lights that turn on when you pass a sensor, with no ability to turn off the apparatus. Needless to say, when you have to go the restroom in the middle of the night, you get blinded yourself plus your partner wakes up

From the super friendly staff, to the wonderful open hotel design, to the delicious in hotel meals, the Hyatt Regency Mexico City is AMAZING! I highly recommend this terrific hotel to any and all family and friends.

The Hyatt Regency Mexico City is very well situated, across from Chapultepec Park in Polanco, and offers luxury and comfort steps away from where you need to be. This was my second trip to CDMX and my second stay at the Hyatt Regency. I will definitely be back.

We were in Mexico City for a week. Trying to get advices from the Concierge about what to explore and see were almost impossible. What we got was just useless printout. We ended up go on the internet for all advices. Useless concierge.

I've stayed at this Hyatt several times on business.  The staff is very attentive, the rooms are fairly large and well maintained.  Beds are comfortable.  Great food and beverage service.  Excllent workout facilities.

All staff from Hyatt Regency Mexico City was wonderful and helpful. Very clean and nice rooms. The hotel is located in a very nice area A lot of restaurants with different options in the area. I totally recommend the place for business or vacation trip

My Hyatt experience  in Mexico City exceeded my previous Hyatt stays in the United States. I was expecting the usual sub par experience of the Hyatt's in The United States. But much to my surprise I was treated to an amazing experience and would highly recommend this hotel.

Make sure you have all reservation info in place and if you make any change have them print a copy. They will not inform you when changing rates and conditions and you will only learn this when checking out, including doubling your original rate on the reservation.

Beautiful hotel in a beautiful area of Mexico City. Many amenities, walking to many attractions and world class shopping. Felt very safe and content at all times during our stay. I highly recommend this hotel and Mexico City. Looking forward to returning to see more of the attractions I havent seen yet.

Very rude! Charged wrong amounts  and still haven’t fixed the problem! Not a lot of people were able to speak English ! So very hard to communicate. Room was dirty and half the lights didn’t work !  About 30 family members went and everyone got charged different amounts and when u confronted the desk they disagreed

The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable and hotel is VERY clean and well staffed.  Everyone is extremely accommodating and the location is perfect for walking to any kind of restaurant or patisserie.

Hotel located nicely in a calm area. Service minded and friendly staff who do their outmost to keep customers happy and feel welcome. Breakfast buffet is a nice selection with typical Mexican food and well done. The hotel have also 2 Japaneese resturant👍👍

Visited Mexico City for a one day business trip.  The stay at the Hyatt was unsurpassed!  From the front desk staff professional demeanor to the friendliness of the housekeeping, to the great service from the hotel’s Restaurant. The location is excellent and views to the city were spectacular!  Will definitely rerurn!

The hotel is in a great area - there are several little cafes within an easy walk and Ubers are plentiful. The design of the hotel is modern and it's well maintained. It has the best fitness center I've ever seen in a hotel anywhere. Staff is very helpful.

Hyatt Regency at Polanco area in Mexico DF is great hotel for business trip. The staff is very nice and professional making your stay a really nice one. The Gym is very well equiped, clean and well attended. Rooms are big enough, clean and internet works fine. Foos options are very good and Breakfast is also very good. Location for business is a very good one.

I have been coming to these Hotel for years and the service is always perfect. The staff trully makes you feel at home, at restaurants, at the spa and the front desk. For me is one of the best breakfast buffet in the city, and I have tried plenty. The value to the price is amazing.

We had a great visit.  We were upgraded to the 33rd Fl with a park view.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  The breakfast buffet is fantastic and the cocktails are yummy!  Will definitely stay here again.

We had an amazing time. Great globalist recognition. We were upgraded to a beautiful suite on the 41st floor with amazing views and the club was very nice as well. This will be our go to hotel in Mexico City going forward.

Great service, concierge went out of their way to secure dinner reservations. Fantastic view and location. Great gym. I had access to the Regency club, which enhanced the experience with good food and drink throughout the day

On impulse we decided to come to Mexico City for six days to visit museums and to enjoy this lifely city in January. Without much planning, we know the trip will work out fine if we stay at the Hyatt RegencyMexico Ciy. It is located at an excellent location that is upscale, safe, clean and cloise to many places we want to visit. In short, it is next to the Chaputepec Park and there are 5-6  museums within walking distances. Choosing a location in a big place like Mexico City is important. After making the reservation, we emailed the Conceige Desk for the transfer service from the airport. We got prompt responses, and were picked up by one of their drivers in a nice sedan. Regarding  services at the hotel, staff at the Reception Desk, Conceige Desk, House Keeping and Resturants

The hotel is in an excellent location.  There are parks, museums, zoo, and excellent restaurants in easy walking distance.  The hotel is very modern and all the staff were very nice, helpful and very efficient.

An excellent hotel for location, price, and service. With the subway station only steps away from the hotel, there is easy access to the entire city.  We highly recommend staying at this location when visiting Mexico City.

Splendid property in the elegant Polenco neighborhood.  Very high level of cleanliness.  Delightful stay in every regard.  Large pool is very clean and kept at perfect temperature.  Great fitness center.  Towels are capacious. Sundeck offers very comfortable loungers; some in full sun and some shaded. Soundproofing in rooms was excellent offering a very restful night's sleep.

One of the best Hyatt's I've ever visited.  Top notch five star experience in ultra modern building.  Located in Polanco, it's perfect for a visit to CDMX.  Rooms were state of the art.  Furnishings were great.  Spa and pool were amazing.

Beautiful and friendly hotel in a great location.  The hotel is in Polanco, which is a very upscale neighborhood.  Depending on traffic it would take between 25-45 minutes to get to the downtown sites and the airport via Uber.  It's about 25 minutes if you leave early in the morning/late in evening or during the weekends, but at least 45 minutes any other time.   We stayed here for 4 nights and were very impressed.  The lobby is beautiful and has a few shops and restaurants.  The reception staff was very friendly and helpful and spoke great English.  We had a great room with a view overlooking Chupaltepec Park and even found a few English language channels on the TV.  The hotel is about a 10 minute walk to the main street of Polanco, which has lots of restaurants.  We also had a

Beautiful hotel, wonderful staff in a great section of the city. Staff helped us find unusual restaurants. Close to park with Sunday market, free zoo and street food.  We only ate breakfast in the hotel as we wanted to explore local food.

Clean rooms, spacious and central location always love the complimentary water friendly staff . Good size swimming pool, lounge area , sauna and gym. Perfect  stay for first time in Mexico City. Expensive excursions. Easy check in and check out .

My husband and I spent six very comfortable nights at the Hyatt Regency Mexico City. We booked a Regency Level room, which enabled us to eat a wonderful breakfast buffet in the 40th floor dining area, as well as enjoy the complementary evening canapés and beverages.  Located in the leafy and safe Polanco area, we were able to walk to the Museum of Anthropology and through Chapultepec Park. Also, it is centrally located for travel to the Zocalo Plaza and to the Coyacan area.  If you want to see the Frida Khalo Museum in Coyacan, or Diego Rivera's History of Mexico murals at the Palacio Nacional, make reservations online, as there is limited access.

It was a great pleasure to return to the Hyatt!  The service was excellent and the room very comfortable - this time on the 17th floor!  The lobby restaurant offers a tasty breakfast with an omelette bar.  It's also a great place to meet colleagues at the end of the day for drinks.  I look forward to returning on my next trip to Mexico City!

Hotel was very nice. Unfortunately our final cost was 80% higher than the quoted room rate. Part of the difference was local taxes, but they charge you exorbitant amounts for anything extra. For example, the 1L bottled water in your room is $7.50 if you drink it, and we were afraid to drink the tap water in Mexico. Buyer beware.

The entire staff was professional, attentive, simply great service... The rooms were clean showers was also very clean. The gym, sauna and steam room was clean and the staff was very helpful. The price is not cheap, but it was worth it...

It the heart of the city with great restaurants and attractions within walking distance. Modern and updated rooms; secure!  Club level is an excellent value add, great for quiet meetings, breakfast daily, happy hour, or, just relaxing somewhere other than the lobby level restaurant.  Nice, well equipped gym to enjoy during your stay.

I stayed here on business - nice location. Felt very safe and clean. There is a helicopter pad on the roof which is pretty cool but unfortunately I used a taxi to get here.  Ask for a room on a higher floor so you can see the great view.

This hotel has the best service, rooms, breakfast, bar, location & gym available!  I don't know what else to say except we had a wonderful time at this hotel. The check-in & check-out process was flawless, no waiting.

Lovely hotel, staff all very friendly, efficient and professional in their activities.  Breakfast buffet is out of this world…a 2 hour grazing feast in a relaxed atmosphere.  Gym facilities are superb, with the added factor of altitude training as it’s at 7500’ above sea level. Really nice surrounding neighbourhood, and close to the fabulous Chapultepec park.

This is a review I would not like to be sharing.  However, let's start with the positives: great location, good rooms, decent wifi speed.  On the not so positive side I will start with the most noticeable one: staff is truly unhelplful and int some cases bordering rude. This hotel really needs to work on training their staff, they seem to be unhappy about their jobs and avoid interacting with guests (with some exceptions).  Also on the improvement list is the qualify of the food served: it´s mediocre, mostly  breakfast at Rulfo,  however, they´re not shy about charging a fortune for it.  I also found their lifts to be funny, they have at least 8 of them, however, at times only 1 seems to be going up or down as it stops in every other floor.   Fortunately, there are other

This amazing hotel makes the top experience in Mexico City. The attention to detail, anticipation of guests needs makes a real five stars hotel and a luxury experience. We will be back. If you are visiting Mexico City you must stay here. I recommend to have Club Lounge access room. Extremely satisfy with the food and all the service we received.

Really nice hotel with wonderful, kind staff. Comfortable, well appointed rooms.Good food. Concierge services impeccable. Beautiful park and restaurants within walking distances. Great value with full services.

We stayed bed only.  16th floor with park view.  Comfortable, quiet and smooth as expected.  Very nice location.     6 nights ago we stayed in a boutique hotel nearby.  Really not worth it.    I wish breakfast was included in our rate, though.  I wonder if there is a way to include it by booking directly with the hotel?  Thank you

Everything is good. But I wish the bed was a bit bigger. It's too small to sleep with 4 years kid on one bed. Location is good and hotel was comfortable to stay.  Parking lot is safe and there is many space.

Overall, a nice place to stay convenient to our activities.  Polanco is a great area with close choices for meals, etc.  Great to overlook Chipultepec Park and be able to walk or use Hop on Hop off busses and Ubers to Centro/Roma and other neighborhoods.  Really nice gym/pool/spa services

Hyatt suppose to be a exclusive hotel, but to be honest it’s not. Let me start with the breakfast, you can probably get all kind of food either by picking it up at the counter or by ordering it at the counter. You can serv you self juice, water , yogurt and all kind of food, but not the coffee! No the coffee you have to ask some of the very busy waiters who is literally running between the tables to clean up, put clean cutlery and serving coffee. If they don’t’ carry the coffee pot, they have to run (literally again) to pick up one and then on the way to you pour coffee to the folks on the way, and some times there will be enough coffee left for you. I don’t know who has designed this “service” but in my book it’s plan stupid.  The second issue I’ve had was about the late

Everthing was nice at the hotel. The hotel is in great condition. The japanese restaurant is one of the best in town. The Polanco area is great to walk around, safe and lots of restaurants and places to visit.

STAFF: friendly and competent ACCOMODATIONS: clean and user feiendly. Free bottled water (important !) USB chargers. Excellent water pressure on upper floors. Free fast WiFi. FOOD: good restaurants. Excellent breakfast buffet (not included.) Good drink selection at the bar. AMENITIES: good gym, sauna, yoga center facilities ( INCLUDED). Good businesses center and conference center. SECURITY: always on site but completely unobtrusive  COST: pricey (but worth it.)  CONs: ... unless your company springs for your bar tab, it may be more cost effective to grab a drink at one of the many excellent bars in Polanco area outside the hotel. .... doors between rooms are solid wood, which is good for security minded guests, but provides a superb acoustic conduit to your neighbours.

We stayed at the Hyatt one night passing through. The staff checking us in were accommodating & friendly. The Hyatt is in a great location close to Chapultepec Park & the Zoo. The hotel is nice & has a great view of the city from the Club Lounge on the 40th floor. We have stayed in several Hyatt’s & they are always top notch. We found the food quality in club lounge below normal standards & not replenished regularly. Some of the cheap filler foods like popcorn were untouched. Deserts had good flavour but seemed strange with jello in them. Cold bottled water was a challenge to get. It was hidden in the cupboard & warm when the fridges were not refilled. When we left our bellman was helpfull, friendly & awesome to talk with. I didn’t catch his name but he was from originally from

I was on a business trip and i had a good stay! Lots of restaurants and shopping nearby, park is a great place to walk around in the evening. Nice clean room with a view of the park. Breakfast was included but I found it to be very disorganized where they seat you and disappear, on one day i almost left as my black tea had not been delivered for 20 minutes and i was done eating.

Nice and friendly staff Good Pool GOod basquet and tennis court Near our tournament, near chapultepec, nice restaurants around and inside the hotel. Safe place in mexico city. Sotres of brands, around. Tacos, beer, coffee near walking is safe

One of the best hotels and nicest Hyatts I have ever stayed out.  The rooms are perfect and the food and beverage was outstanding.  Hight recommend.  Breakfast buffet was resort quality and the pastry market was incredible.

Hotel is in an impeccable condition, friendly and helpful staff, gym was in a like new condition, awesome tennis courts with instructors, breakfast was included with dozens of choices, all top notch, very nice experience overall.

Amazing location, the hotel has many amenities and is a great place to stay  I recommend it 100% the spa, the business center and the lobby have all the amenities and served all my needs during my 9 day stay in CDMX

This is a very nice Hyatt Regency.  all the staff is top notch, especially, Ivan, our Bell man who helped us so much.  We had access to the lounge and the suite we had was extremely nice and roomy.  After four nights at the Hyatt Regency we move for three nights to the Hyatt Andaz.  I left my iPhone in our room and the HR and the Andaz staff coordinated the retreival and delivery of my phone.  Hand in glove.  Hyatt does a spectacular job in CDMX

Great location, fantastic service, excellent hotel.  It was the perfect location surrounded by parks, great restaurants and museums.  The service at the hotel, restaurants, and club longe was great.  The room was spotless and comfortable.

This is a very nice hotel, but we were supposed to be upgraded to a suite upon checkin as globalist and the front desk clerk said they were sold out, which is a total lie because suites were available online to book so we had to call a manager down to get our suite &  it was all embarrassing and a huge hassle and I just don’t understand why the front desk staff would lie like that.

Great comfortable stay, staff were very kind and helpful. It was lovely being so close to Chapultepec park. Food was good and great room service. Hotel was clean and to a high standard. We found it fairly quiet. Aircon worked well. I saw a couple of people mentioned about bottled water before we came being a concern, we were given x2 bottles per day with the room type we booked - and regardless there is a water refill station in the lobby by concierge, so just bring your reusable bottles!

I had a lovely room with a view, outrageously good concierge support and all within walking distance of good dining and tourist attractions. I asked for alcohol to be removed from the fridge and for some personal items and it was all handled in a flash!

Clean and awesome room and excellent reception, I have enjoyed my six days stay at the hotel. In addition, the hotel has great gym, swimming pool, and ground tennis court free of charge with extended hours of delicious breakfast.

This hotel is gorgeous. Service is impeccable and quality of breakfast and housekeeping is brilliant. Well located if you need to run a few errands. Very close to the magnificent Anthropology Museum.   Mattress was incredible !!  Highly recommended from my side

I usually stay at the JW Marriott in Mexico City, but the JW’s rates skyrocketed recently. So I decided to try the Hyatt.   Overview: Good value, clean hotel, good staff, but a bit noisy with some frustrating room quirks   Arrival: arrived by Uber from the airport, very helpful doorman   Checkin: efficient check  Room (Room 3315): For a standard king room, spacious and properly equipped. King bed, chaise lounge, mini-coffee maker, all the normal items. Mini-refrigerator stuffed full of things for sale. I’d much prefer a usable mini-refrigerator.   Bed: average bed and linens. Frustrating detail- lights behind the headboard were constantly on. I had to stuff towels behind the headboard to get any sleep.   Sleep quality: The insulation between the rooms is a little thin. I could

Stayed here for a wedding. The staff was exceptional! Everyone was very helpful and friendly. The hotel and grounds were impeccable. we felt very safe in the hotel, and in the area in which the hotel is located. We were able to walk to restaurants, parks, and museums.

Parking tickets a problem, invoice difficult to obtain, many calls and nothing. If you charge to your room the add 8% additional for Taxi. Breack fast start late, there is no coffe of cookies for early birds. Resturant Rufo very noice specialiy when waiters putin plates to the tables. Yoshimi and Tepanyaki open at 13:30 late for international travelesr

We loved staying here, gym, pool, amenities, location were all awesome. The view of the city was fantastic. We had club access and enjoy treats or wine at the end of every day. The house keeping did a wonderful job as well.  We will be staying here again!

Second time staying at this property. Location is perfect. Hotel feels modern and airy. Beds were comfortable and I would recommend that the hotel upgrade the coffee service in the room for a hotel in this category and in this neighborhood I would expect Nespresso or something similar. The coffee in the room was not drinkable and for me that’s an important start of the day

Excellent location and very safe. Beautiful area with many restaurants within walking distance. Rooms are clean and staff is excellent. This hotel has several outstanding restaurants. The club lounge is very good.

The hotel is located in a nice quiet affluent area full of western restaurants and parks. We used the opportunity for evening and morning walks. The rooms are nice and the staff friendly. Two disappointments: the lounge and the breakfast. The staff at the lounge sticks to Mexican guests, and keeps away from foreigners, I guess they;re afraid of speaking English. The quality of the lounge offerings varies from tasty to tasteless. Tasteless absolutely dominates the desert section. The breakfast downstairs is a huge and rather chaotic operation, nothing is marked (bakery, or cereals, or fruits), only after three days you will discover that you completely missed the cereal section.  The bakery section is hidden very well too. We were surprised that nobody recognized us in the

Found a cockroach right after we checked in to our room. Staff was less than approachable. Service isn't that great, from what you would expect. Not sure I would go back to Hyatt, after this experience. Plenty of other "nice" hotels in Mexico City to stay at, that have better service than the Hyatt Regency. Booked through Amex as part of The Hotel Collection - but didn't really get any upgrades either. So I would recommend booking a different hotel through Amex Travel that will actually give you the complimentary upgrades.

Great location - lots of park area surrounding the property & lots of great eateries within 10 mins walk. Great Japanese restaurant in the hotel & a good coffee shop too. All staff were very helpful. Housekeeping didn’t replenish water or tea bags without daily follow up.

The best hotel on the street This is my go to hotel, I don't even think twice. Everything is perfect, rooms, amenities such as gym and pool great breakfast, service I even received a complementary credit to spend during my stay

I always like overall Hyatt experience, specially the breakfast at the lobby restaurant, but this time I was surprised by the quality of the gym. All kinds of equipment and all very new. Looking forward to try the tennis courts there in my next trip to Mexico city

Hyatt Regency stay is awesome, all amenities room food comfort location customer service are just 7 star. The rooms are spacious comfortable bed and bathroom are great. For sure will stay again, we travelled with 6 couples to celebrate birthdays and it was perfect, close to good areas

Wow! We loved everything about our week vacation stay at the Hyatt Regency,  MX CD in Polanco neighborhood. Luxurious room with access to the Regency Club made us feel very pampered ,Pool, Spa and gym facilities are top notch as is this beautiful neighborhood with walking access to parks, huge variety of excellent restaurants and shopping. Subway line very close -fast, safe and clean. Go!

Excellent, clean, safe and newly renovated hotel in the heart of Polanco near the park and Masaryk. Our room was recently renovated, very modern and quiet. The bathroom was excellent, with a large shower and the bed was very comfortable. Would definitely recommend!

We are globalist and we’re guaranteed an upgrade at check-in but the front desk staff told us they had no suites available, which was a total lie as the hotel was nowhere near at capacity & wasn’t sold out of suites because we checked online & saw availability. We had to call down a manager to verify that they did have suites available and it was very embarrassing and a huge hassle for us to go through this. I don’t understand why this hotel doesn’t treat globalist better. I hope the manager, relations manager or GM is reading this review and they can reach out to us directly to verify. Brandon/Brooke zandt stay: 4/19-4/21 . we shouldn’t have to fight the front desk staff for our awarded upgrades. This is a direct Hyatt brand too which makes this incidence even more
